Will I, though? RT @SportsCenter: Jon Gruden interviewing Johnny Manziel. You'll want to see this. http://t.co/wwIpiU5qmQ”

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) August 18, 2014

Berman just nicknamed new Clippers owner Steve Ballmer "Steve 'Basket' Ballmer." Nailed that shit so hard.

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) August 19, 2014

Impossible to listen to music on a train, head against window, watching towns pass by, & not feel like you're in an emotional movie montage

— Dan Gurewitch (@DanGurewitch) August 19, 2014

C-list celebrities, you only have a few more days to get attention for doing the ice bucket thing before the media moves on.

— Jeverett15 (@jeverett15) August 18, 2014

Next week, a few publicists are going to be fired for not convincing their clients to dump ice water on their heads in a timely manner.

— Jeverett15 (@jeverett15) August 18, 2014

It's a shame that none of these ice bucket challenge videos are raising awareness of turning your phone horizontally to film

— Shira (@shiraselko) August 18, 2014

“@NightmareJess: @NathanFillion why did you pick @twhiddleston?”

I did that for the ladies. You’re welcome.

— Nathan Fillion (@NathanFillion) August 19, 2014

There needs to be an ice bucket challenge to recover from the effects of shirtless ice bucket challenges.

— Matt Bellassai (@MattBellassai) August 18, 2014

Are we absolutely sure the Ice Bucket Challenge isn't a Nathan For You bit?

— kevinbiegel (@kbiegel) August 19, 2014

When I was 12, if you'd told me I'd see so many people in my class get buckets of ice water to the head, I'd have expected to enjoy it more.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) August 19, 2014

The only explanation for so much of this Top Model Cycle 21 premiere is Nathan For You.

— itsonlyzach (@itsonlyzach) August 19, 2014

I love television so much

— Julie Klausner (@julieklausner) August 19, 2014

Shouldn't the #OrphanBlack credits just be Maslany's name repeated 10 times?

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) August 19, 2014

@AndrewDaar If you say Tatiana Maslany's name ten times, she actually replaces you, taking over your life and living it better.

— Christopher Dole (@chrisdole86) August 19, 2014

I pay Netflix $8.99 a month to browse titles without ever figuring out what I want to watch.

— Jeverett15 (@jeverett15) August 19, 2014

Empty Whiteness: A Pretty Much Every Network Original Series pic.twitter.com/VSnzEO7YDI

— Sophie 🌹 (@insopherable) August 19, 2014

Defiance sure was having a good season before they decided to muck around in the Bad Ideas Bucket.

— Devan Joneson (@djoneson) August 19, 2014

tweets.author_name: Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars
tweets.html:
It bothers me that no one on You Can't Do That on Television realized they could quickly clean the slime off by immediately saying "water."

— Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars (@TheEricGoldman) August 19, 2014

Most compelling TV I'm waching right now other than the news: Maggie Gyllenhaal in The Honorable Woman. Which is also sort of the news.

— Mark Harris (@MarkHarrisNYC) August 19, 2014

I just realized my Tivo didn't record Reckless??? *THROWS TIVO OUT WINDOW*

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) August 19, 2014

This is because it was rescheduled from last week! *THROWS CBS OUT WINDOW* *THROWS GOLF OUT WINDOW*

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) August 19, 2014

RIP, Don Pardo. Somewhere at the pearly gates St. Peter is getting the best booming voice-over intro ever.

— Steven Zeitchik (@ZeitchikWaPo) August 19, 2014

I will always be grateful that Don Pardo lived long enough to say my name but I'm ashamed it was told to never call his house again.

— Derick Armijo (@DerickArmijo) August 19, 2014

Any SNL actor will tell u:the ultimate moment of your career was hearing Don Pardo say your name. Each week he represented a dream come true

— Rachel Dratch (@TheRealDratch) August 19, 2014

I think Big Brother must have the highest percentage of viewers who publicly declare "I'm done!" and then keep watching anyway. #BB16

— Andy Dehnart (@realityblurred) August 19, 2014

Rising Star is STILL ON?!

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) August 19, 2014

Hospitals are always extremely busy after cliffhangers. #DALLAS #DallasTNT

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) August 19, 2014

Elena giving best "son of a bitch" face and line delivery since Lily Aldrin left out screens. #DallasTNT #Dallas #HIMYM

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) August 19, 2014

As it becomes Under the Dome time here at the Fowler household, a dark, dank depression descends. Diabolically dampening dreams.

— Matt Fowler (@TheMattFowler) August 19, 2014

Why didn’t Barbie tell him to email “Hey everyone in Chester’s Mill! Jump into the big hole in the ground! YOU CAN LEAVE!” ? #UnderTheDome

— Matt Fowler (@TheMattFowler) August 19, 2014

So can we talk bout how ABC Family shows are pulling desperate finale "please don't cancel us cliffhangers" like never before? #regimechange

— Danielle Turchiano (@danielletbd) August 19, 2014

Derek also does palm readings. Whatever he can to get a few bucks and maintain his simple hobo lifestyle. #TeenWolf

— melissa miller (@Serrae) August 19, 2014

The #TheFosters title sequence should always play at the end of the ep so you can feel better about the emotional trauma you just went thru.

— melissa miller (@Serrae) August 19, 2014

Tonight's #SwitchedAtBirth should come with a box of tissues and someone to hug you.

— Melissa Mann (@PhantomRat) August 19, 2014

Elise says Chris is a gentleman, which is how I'd describe a guy who sleeps with you at a La Quinta on a first date. #BachelorInParadise

— Dana Weiss (@Possessionista) August 19, 2014

Marquel: proving that the best way to get over someone is to get under everybody in the Bachelor franchise. #BachelorInParadise

— Dana Weiss (@Possessionista) August 19, 2014

By "putting my time and energy into Robert,” Michelle means "into his pants," right? #BachelorInParadise

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) August 19, 2014

Marquel doesn't need to be the next Bachelor. Apparently, he's already dated 25 women on national TV. #bachelorinparadise

— Emily L. Foley (@EmilyLFoley) August 19, 2014

Ashlee says love is about things you can't see. Like bodyparts in your freezer. #BachelorInParadise

— Dana Weiss (@Possessionista) August 19, 2014

"I don't kiss on a first date," Things people who kiss on a first date ALWAYS say. #BachelorInParadise

— Dana Weiss (@Possessionista) August 19, 2014

#BachelorInParadise is just a bikini catalog with back stabbing and close ups of lizards.

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) August 19, 2014

"I feel like @#%$" - things @chrisjbukowski says after a first date. #BachelorInParadise

— Dana Weiss (@Possessionista) August 19, 2014

I just wanna fast forward to the part where Ashlee tries to get Graham to register at Bloomingdales on their date. #BachelorInParadise

— Dana Weiss (@Possessionista) August 19, 2014

#BachelorInParadise reminds all married people that your marriage is worth the work.

— Dana Weiss (@Possessionista) August 19, 2014

"I follow you on Instagram," AshLee tells Graham silently adding "And I drive by your house with my lights off." #BachelorInParadise

— Andrea Lavinthal (@andilavs) August 19, 2014

Graham says there's a gray area between first date and not. By gray area I'm pretty sure he means restraining order. #BachelorInParadise

— Dana Weiss (@Possessionista) August 19, 2014

Hey I just met you, and this is crazy. But your glasses are freaking me out, Marquel. Contacts, maybe? #BachelorInParadise

— Dana Weiss (@Possessionista) August 19, 2014

Just so you know, #BachelorInParadise did NOT just make me tear up. Nothing like that just happened. At all.

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) August 19, 2014

I love BuzzFeed, I don’t believe serious and fun need a wall between them. But I will never get used to this. pic.twitter.com/9rBpC1eWFo

— On a Merry coXmas (@anamariecox) August 18, 2014

Where's @Pres_Bartlet?

— Brian Stelter (@brianstelter) August 18, 2014

If you're an all-white PR firm and the city of Ferguson tries to hire you and you don't advise them against it… you failed your first test.

— Jamison Foser (@jamisonfoser) August 18, 2014

Al Sharpton has the most expensive, broadcast quality, condenser mic attached to his lapel and he STILL insists on yelling the news.

— Dick Champagne (@DerekSheen) August 19, 2014

still hard to fathom all the photos I've seen coming out of Ferguson and that Bill Murray isn't in any of them

— Matt Oswalt (@MattOswaltVA) August 19, 2014

If you are a reporter in Ferguson who hasn't been detained, can you even show your face?

— Jenni Konner (@JenniKonner) August 19, 2014

Chris Hayes is putting on a gas mask, in America.

— emokidsloveme (@emokidsloveme) August 19, 2014

On CNN, one reporter in bullet proof vest interviewing another who just got gassed. Good times…

— Adam Barken (@adambarken) August 19, 2014

#ofcourse "Fox News "Race In America" panel Exclusively White People. pic.twitter.com/0E3x9KC8Ve #Ferguson #MikeBrown” h/t @TheBaxterBean

— Steve Marmel (@Marmel) August 19, 2014

So CNN is suppose to be airing episode of 1960s. Ferguson police following in footsteps of Bull Conor & Daley's Chicago PD

— David J. Leonard (@drdavidjleonard) August 19, 2014

OMG the look on this guy's face when the white lady suggested using water cannons on the #Ferguson protesters: pic.twitter.com/cV1KMkcZZp

— Nick Baumann (@NickBaumann) August 19, 2014

Very adorable Google Doodle today where the "G" shoots the "e" 6x, then "oogl" gets teargassed and has their constitutional rights stripped.

— Dan Ozzi (@danozzi) August 19, 2014

watching these journalists drive around looking for the Ferguson media corral and get rerouted at every stop is existential horror

— Molly Lambert (@mollylambert) August 19, 2014

the Twilight Zone version of this ends with the entire population of Ferguson arrested and the cops shooting at an endless fog of tear gas

— meaning machine (@EricThurm) August 19, 2014

Turn off the TV right now, young man. RT @eclecticbrotha: Oh God, Nancy Grace got a copy of Michael Brown's autopsy report.

— Imani Gandy Canes (@AngryBlackLady) August 19, 2014

CNN: If Your Embarrassing Uncle Were The News

Has the media gone overboard in covering the media in Ferguson? Our reporters roundtable discusses.

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) August 19, 2014
